meanings.sent1: She tried to overskate the puddle but ended up falling in.
meanings.sent2: The hockey player accidentally overskated the puck, giving the opposing team a chance to score.
meanings.sent3: The penguin decided to overskate the fish, thinking it would be a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: His ambition to overskate his own record pushed him to train harder.
meanings.sent5: The daredevil attempted to overskate the flaming hoop, thrilling the audience.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed (a limit or boundary)
meanings.sent1: The company's profits overskated all expectations for the quarter.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness always overskates any negativity she encounters.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity overskated its fear, leading it to explore the unknown room.
meanings.sent4: His determination to overskate his fears propelled him to take on new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The student's creativity overskated the teacher's imagination, impressing everyone in the class.
